definition: A person who publicly supports or recommends a particular cause or policy; to publicly recommend or support.
mnemonic: Advocate sounds like 'add-vocate,' indicating someone who adds their voice in support of something.
visual_representation: Picture a lawyer passionately defending their client in court, symbolizing advocacy.
example_sentence: She is a strong advocate for animal rights and regularly participates in protests.

definition: To say something suddenly and without careful consideration.
mnemonic: Blurt sounds like 'blow out,' indicating words that come out suddenly, often by mistake.
visual_representation: Imagine someone accidentally shouting out a secret in the middle of a quiet room, symbolizing a blurt.
example_sentence: He couldn’t help but blurt out the surprise, ruining the party.

definition: The base frame of a motor vehicle or other wheeled conveyance.
mnemonic: Chassis sounds like 'cha-sis,' indicating the structural framework of a vehicle.
visual_representation: Picture the bare frame of a car without the body, showing the underlying chassis.
example_sentence: The mechanic inspected the car’s chassis for any signs of damage.

definition: In a very poor condition as a result of disuse and neglect; a person without a home, job, or property.
mnemonic: Derelict sounds like 'dare-licked,' as if something has been left to deteriorate and decay.
visual_representation: Picture an abandoned, crumbling building covered in vines, symbolizing something derelict.
example_sentence: The derelict house had been abandoned for years and was falling apart.

definition: A person who organizes and operates a business or businesses, taking on greater than normal financial risks in order to do so.
mnemonic: Entrepreneur sounds like 'enter-preneur,' indicating someone who enters into new ventures.
visual_representation: Picture a businessperson starting a new company from scratch, symbolizing entrepreneurship.
example_sentence: The young entrepreneur started her own tech company at the age of 23.

mnemonic: Forbearance sounds like 'for-bear-ance,' as in bearing with something or someone with patience.
visual_representation: Imagine someone calmly waiting while others around them lose their patience, symbolizing forbearance.
example_sentence: His forbearance in the face of provocation was admirable.

mnemonic: Guffaw sounds like 'laugh-aw,' indicating a loud burst of laughter.
visual_representation: Picture a group of people bursting into loud, hearty laughter, symbolizing a guffaw.
example_sentence: His joke was so funny that it elicited a guffaw from the entire room.

definition: To pay attention to; take notice of; careful attention.
mnemonic: Heed sounds like 'hear-ed,' indicating listening carefully or paying attention.
visual_representation: Imagine someone stopping to carefully read and follow a warning sign, symbolizing heeding advice.
example_sentence: He should have heeded the warning signs and stayed away from the risky investment.

definition: To encourage or stir up (violent or unlawful behavior).
mnemonic: Incite sounds like 'in-sight,' indicating putting something in someone’s sight to provoke action.
visual_representation: Picture a leader stirring up a crowd to take aggressive action, symbolizing incitement.
example_sentence: The politician was accused of inciting violence with his inflammatory speech.

definition: The flat area between the waist and knees of a seated person; to overtake (a competitor in a race) and thereby lead them by one or more circuits.
hindi_meaning: गोद, गोद में रखना; दौड़ में एक चक्कर लगाना
mnemonic: Lap sounds like 'lap' of water or a race, indicating both sitting and overtaking in a circuit.
visual_representation: Imagine a child sitting comfortably in their parent’s lap or a runner lapping another in a race.
example_sentence: The child sat in her mother’s lap during the storytime.

definition: Amusement, especially as expressed in laughter.
mnemonic: Mirth sounds like 'merry-earth,' indicating a world full of laughter and joy.
visual_representation: Picture a room full of people laughing and enjoying each other’s company, symbolizing mirth.
example_sentence: The party was filled with mirth and laughter, making it a memorable evening.

definition: Knowing everything; having unlimited understanding or knowledge.
mnemonic: Omniscient sounds like 'omni-scient,' indicating all-knowing or fully knowledgeable.
visual_representation: Imagine a wise, all-knowing figure like a deity or philosopher, symbolizing omniscience.
example_sentence: The narrator in the novel is omniscient, providing insights into all the characters’ thoughts.

definition: To make something continue indefinitely; to preserve from extinction.
mnemonic: Perpetuate sounds like 'per-pet-uate,' as if keeping a pet forever, indicating making something last.
visual_representation: Picture a candle that never burns out, symbolizing perpetuation.
example_sentence: The charity aims to perpetuate the memory of the founder by continuing his work.

definition: A person who deserts and betrays an organization, country, or set of principles; having treacherously changed allegiance.
mnemonic: Renegade sounds like 'run-against,' indicating someone who goes against or betrays.
visual_representation: Picture someone leaving a group and turning against their former allies, symbolizing a renegade.
example_sentence: The renegade soldier was captured after attempting to betray his comrades.

definition: A length of cloth or an enveloping garment in which a dead person is wrapped for burial; to cover or envelop so as to conceal from view.
mnemonic: Shroud sounds like 'cloud,' which can cover or obscure something, much like a shroud.
visual_representation: Imagine a body wrapped in a white cloth for burial, symbolizing a shroud.
example_sentence: The mist shrouded the mountain, making it invisible from afar.

definition: Emotionally disturbing or distressing; relating to or causing psychological trauma.
mnemonic: Traumatic sounds like 'trauma,' indicating something that causes deep emotional distress.
visual_representation: Picture someone experiencing a shocking event, leaving them visibly shaken, symbolizing trauma.
example_sentence: The accident was so traumatic that she had nightmares for weeks.

definition: (Of a person, especially a man) courteous and refined in manner.
mnemonic: Urbane sounds like 'urban,' indicating someone with the polished manners often associated with city life.
visual_representation: Imagine a well-dressed gentleman at a formal event, symbolizing urbane behavior.
example_sentence: The urbane host greeted each guest with a warm smile and impeccable manners.

definition: The language or dialect spoken by the ordinary people in a particular country or region; spoken as one’s mother tongue.
mnemonic: Vernacular sounds like 'verbal-cular,' indicating everyday spoken language.
visual_representation: Picture people in a local market speaking in their native dialect, symbolizing vernacular language.
example_sentence: The novel is written in the vernacular, making it more relatable to the local audience.

definition: (Of a plant) to become dry and shriveled; to cause harm or damage to something.
mnemonic: Wither sounds like 'wither away,' indicating something slowly dying or losing vitality.
visual_representation: Imagine a once vibrant flower wilting and drying up, symbolizing withering.
example_sentence: The flowers began to wither after being left in the sun without water.
